Dr Davide Dominoni believes that city lights convince the birds there is no end to the day. Robins are adapted to hunting insects in the dark, so they remain active all day if there is sufficient artificial light, but they are less effective at building nests at night because they need darkness to build sheltered, cup-shaped nests.
